com.ls.drupal
Class DrupalClient

java.lang.Object
  com.ls.drupal.DrupalClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseRequest.OnResponseListener
public class DrupalClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements BaseRequest.OnResponseListener

Class is used to generate requests based on DrupalEntities and attach them to request queue

Author:
lemberg

Nested Class Summary
static interface DrupalClient.OnResponseListener
           
static interface DrupalClient.RequestProgressListener
          Can be used in order to react on request count changes (start/success/failure or canceling).

DrupalClient

public DrupalClient(@NonNull
                    java.lang.String theBaseURL,
                    @NonNull
                    Context theContext,
                    @Nullable
                    BaseRequest.RequestFormat theFormat,
                    @Nullable
                    ILoginManager theLoginManager)
Parameters:
theBaseURL - this URL will be appended with AbstractBaseDrupalEntity.getPath()
theContext - application context, used to create request queue
theFormat - server request/response format. Defines format of serialized objects and server response format, see BaseRequest.RequestFormat
theLoginManager - contains user profile data and can update request parameters and headers in order to apply it.

public ResponseData performRequest(BaseRequest request,
                                   boolean synchronous)
Parameters:
request - Request object to be performed
synchronous - if true request result will be returned synchronously
Returns:
ResponseData object, containing request result code and string or error and deserialized object, specified in request.

                                   java.lang.Object tag,
                                   DrupalClient.OnResponseListener listener,
                                   boolean synchronous)
Parameters:
request - Request object to be performed
tag - will be applied to the request and returned in listener
listener -
synchronous - if true request result will be returned synchronously
Returns:

getObject

public ResponseData getObject(AbstractBaseDrupalEntity entity,
                              java.lang.Object responseClassSpecifier,
                              java.lang.Object tag,
                              DrupalClient.OnResponseListener listener,
                              boolean synchronous)
Parameters:
entity - Object, specifying request parameters, retrieved data will be merged to this object.
responseClassSpecifier - Class or Type of the object, returned as data field of ResultData object, can be null if you don't need one.
tag - will be attached to request and returned in listener callback, can be used in order to cancel request
listener -
synchronous - if true - result will be returned synchronously.
Returns:
ResponceData object or null if request was asynchronous.

cancelByTag

public void cancelByTag(@NonNull
                        java.lang.Object tag)
Parameters:
tag - Cancel all requests, containing given tag. If no tag is specified - all requests are canceled.

cancelAll

public void cancelAll()
Parameters:
tag - Cancel all requests

cancelAllRequestsForListener

public void cancelAllRequestsForListener(@Nullable
                                         DrupalClient.OnResponseListener theListener,
                                         @Nullable
                                         java.lang.Object theTag)
Cancel all requests for given listener with tag

Parameters:
listener - listener to cancel requests for in case if null passed- all requests for given tag will be canceled
tag - to cancel requests for, in case if null passed- all requests for given listener will be canceled

getActiveRequestsCount

public int getActiveRequestsCount()
Returns:
number of requests pending
